Package edu.sjsu.Team15.model

Class UserHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.sjsu.Team15.model.DatabaseHandler
      • edu.sjsu.Team15.model.UserHandler
  • public class UserHandler
extends DatabaseHandler
    File Handler for user files Class is designed to edit to existing user file, which can be created by a static method available in this class. Note: Previous iterations had master and salt variables set, before universal encryption and decryption methods were available. Both are now unused, but could be re-implemented quickly if there's a use. For now, leave both as null and just use the 1-arg constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • verifyUser

        public User verifyUser​(java.lang.String username,
                       SecureCharBuffer password)
        Check if the credentials match in the user file, return the user object if found Using the xml structure leads to security issues, but it uses XPath to allow for straightforward queries of finding elements. If found, it will then automatically prepare the DomainInfo ArrayList and add it to the User object. If errors occur, then null values will be passed, so always check if the value is null
        Parameters:
        username - The username for credential, and salt for file decryption
        password - The password for credential, and buffer for file decryption
        Returns:
        The User object

      • checkUser

        public boolean checkUser​(java.lang.String username)
        Checks if the username is already present in the user database file Used to ensure no duplicates on the database file. NOTE: If somehow username is null, then it will check if anything exists in the file at all. Returns true if something is found, false if there's nothing. Used primarily in test cases, but can work as an additional tool, since null should never be run through here normally.
        Parameters:
        username - The username, must be exact
        Returns:
        Whether the username is taken or not

      • addUser

        public User addUser​(java.lang.String username,
                    SecureCharBuffer password,
                    int clipboardTime,
                    java.io.File secureFile)
        Add a user to the user database file You MUST check if the user is in the file, this function doesn't check and won't check.
        Parameters:
        username - The username for the new user
        password - The password being written (MUST be hashed beforehand)
        clipboardTime - The time for the clipboard
        secureFile - Where the encrypted file will be saved
        Returns:
        The User object, if successfully added. null otherwise.

      • editUser

        public java.lang.Boolean editUser​(java.lang.String username,
                                  SecureCharBuffer password,
                                  int name,
                                  java.lang.String value)
        Edit the user on the user file, and fix the domain file from the change in user credentials
        Parameters:
        username - The salt used in encryption
        password - The char buffer used in encryption
        name - The HandlerConstant of the element that needs to change
        value - The value that will be replacing the original file content
        Returns:
        Whether the edit was successful or not

      • deleteUser

        public java.lang.Boolean deleteUser​(java.lang.String username,
                                    SecureCharBuffer password)
        Delete the user with the matching credentials
        Parameters:
        username - The username we're searching for
        password - The password for verifying that the request came from the user
        Returns:
        true if the user is properly deleted, false otherwise
